comment: Highly recommend Professor Lemberg-She is unlike most Professors in that she'll make you learn the material through a number of assignments due throughout the week. Turn in all your assignments and you will be ready come test time.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class is not meant to be easy. Test are only 50 minutes long. Quizzes are a bit tricky. Mastering engineering id the only tool that you will use most of the time No curve will be given even if you have a 79 in the class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Took her for CE Problem Solving and she is a very good teacher. Lots of homework/quizzes, but she makes you learn it. Looking back on it, I had to study less for tests because I was well-prepared. Would take her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: She's very organized, knowledgeable and a very fair grader. She's good at relating class material with practical engineer skills, she even invites a couple of professional engineers for a class session to discuss what an engineer is expected to do and know at work. She gave 3 homework/quizzes every week, keep up with them and you would be fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Taught a lot about functions and applications of Excel. Extremely useful!!! Homework and quizzes based off the hw every week. As long as you do your part, it is not a difficult course. The final project was extensive, but manageable and she is very easy to communicate with. Gives thorough feedback when you ask questions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Took her for statics and she was amazing, same for her strength of materials course. She makes you work for the grade, but the only class that actually remains in my memory because of it. Easy to get in contact with, and gives thorough responses. Amazing :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: this class is not meant to be easy. if you do the homework and extra practice problems you will be fine for the exams. the quizzes are based on the hw due that day and are pretty easy. i liked her lecture format. her exams are fair i never ran out of time. you must prepare for them, this class takes effort. tries to give the class some humor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: replies to emails quickly. grades fair and gives feedback and points back for work that is shown. quiz and hw everyweek. tests were moderate in difficulty. has a good lecture format. if you do your homework and watch the hybrid videos you will be fine on quizzes and tests. you have to put effort tho this class is not meant to be a cakewalk.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: She is the most fair grader there is. If you show work she will try to get you points. Made alot of jokes to keep the class lively. She teaches great and if your struggling go to her office hours, she really does cares. She can be blunt and sometimes make you feel stupid when you ask a question but it's not intentional. Assignments due every week.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Amazing Professor! I always make sure if she is teaching a course I take her class. Textbook used for homework. Also multiple weekly assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: Took for lab Explains well, little patience for repetitiveness, late work outside influences affecting school work, differing age groups and is straight forward. Has a slight air of "I know better" type of attitude when it comes to what she thinks is the real world. Fair grader, reasonable time frame in grading. Not likely to take her class again
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is good at explaining civil engineering portion of class but absolutely horrible in dynamic portion. I doubt she even knows what she is doing in the dynamic section and the Test questions for the second half of the semester are absolutely out of nowhere. I have no idea where she found these questions. The grade was 79. Something. NO CURVES

Her lectures are very organized and she is very responsive to emails. She is willing to give detailed examples with steps of how to approach a question, and her exams are similar to the style of the quizzes and homework assignments. She is a PE and SE, very inspirational!! I am taking another class of hers next semester. PRACTICE IS KEY
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: she respond very late and she is a tuff grader I had 79.4 and she didn't curve. DON'T TAKE HER!!!!!!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: she is brutal when it comes to grading. half of the class is failing.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: I've learned the most in this class, do the hw and understand it and you should pass the tests. The online portion deals with excel, she walks you through most of it. Do the excel hw as the final project will require you to know it. She gives quizzes over the hw every week. Personality-wise she's not the most approachable person. Lot's of hw!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Lemberg is the best professor I've had at this school. She is very funny, knowledgeable, and her lectures are interesting. If you can keep up with the pace of this course and study the notes, you will be prepared for her exams. She is a lot better of a grader when it comes to the tests compared to the quizzes. SHE'LL MAKE YOU LEARN
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Amazing lectures

comment: Excellent professor, highly intelligent, and readily available outside of class and eager to help students. She doesnt hand out free grades. Expects you to put in the work. I took her every chance I got and learned a lot. She helped me establish a good foundation that made upper level ME classes a lot easier later on.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I think she is a very good professor if your willing to do the work! she does give out a lot of homework. All of her quizzes are based on the homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She's not very reasonable on the workload. We had an online homework due Sunday and a test Wednesday; right before Thanksgiving break. Do your GPA a favor, and take someone else!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took her for ENGR 2214 as well as ENGR 3131. Her class structure was exactly the same. She provides lots of examples and her homework is very consistent. For every homework due there is a quiz to guarantee that you know the material. The quizzes are exactly like the exams which, if you know the material and have attended lectures, are review.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I took this in the summer of 2018 prior to graduating and I thought this class was going to be easy because it was a 2000 level course. I was completely wrong. The exams are pretty tough and require a lot of studying and she is not clear with the material most of the time. YouTube was my best friend all semester long. The project is ridiculous FYI.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I wouldn't take her. Especially in the online environment. Her test are difficult and too long for the time limits that are given. no one finishes on time and the test averages are really low. Shes a nice person however wouldn't take her unless you have money or time to waste.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Will not take this woman again. Took ENGR 3131 with her , Strength of materials is a kind of easy class but you need the professor to make you understand the first concepts very well or you will be lost. Quizzes and Test are tricky , long and you dont have enough time. Does listen to students. Got a D, a killer for a A student. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Gives unreasonable time limits for tests, 50 minutes. No one finishes on time. Test averages are in the 60s, and Tests are worth 50% of your grade. A. little overkill for an online class. Too much work, in too little time. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Shes a good teacher but does t help the class. Our test scores average was always failing. The quizzes and test are unreseamble . The are very difficult and tricky. The quizzes are the biggest turn off. Especially if youre a STEM major and taking other classes. This class became a nuisance. Physics 2 was easier than this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: 3 test about 5 questions each. Questions come from hw and lecture examples. Homework is done in mastering and due on paper every Friday. Also, quizzes are given every Friday as well which sucks. Overall, a good teacher but make sure you know how to complete every question on the tests because its only 5 question and each question is about 20 pts.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: You basically have to pay for mastering engineering and learn everything by yourself... Read the book and do everything by yourself.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I've had her for three classes now. I really enjoy her teaching style. Very straight forward. Homework is like quizzes, quizzes like tests. Print her notes and follow along in class. She is always available during office hours to explain things better. I like her humor too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: She is clearly new to teaching and it seems very bored with it. She makes the material seem extremely uninteresting. I felt her pace of teaching was way too slow and it's hard to stay engaged. Only would recommend her as a last resort, so try to find someone else first!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Lemberg was an awesome teacher. Her lectures were clear and she always made sure students understood the material, even if she had to adjust her teaching. Very approachable during or after class for extra help. and always willing to help. Homework was fair, and it really does helps you. Quizzes/Tests were more than fair. Definitely take her!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Seems to be new to teaching and hasn't found a good style yet. It's hard to have much style with Engineering Statics though. Sounds like she is trying to keep herself going more than the students, and she can be sarcastic much of the time. Repetition is key, work as many different problems as possible, not just the recommended and you will do well.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria
